channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SUREFIRE-1688] Junit Platform test with failing @BeforeAll does not fail the build
item.description:
When using Surefire 3.0.0-SNAPSHOT and JUnit Platform 5.4.2 the following test does not fail the Maven build. 

import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeAll;
import org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions;
public class Tests {

    @BeforeAll
    public static void beforeAll() { Assertions.fail("BeforeAll fail"); }

    @Test
    public void test() { Assertions.fail("Test fail"); }
}

And its output:

[INFO] --- maven-surefire-plugin:3.0.0-SNAPSHOT:test (default-test) @ top-level-project ---
[INFO] 
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------
[INFO]  T E S T S
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Running Tests
[INFO] Tests run: 0, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.015 s - in Tests
[INFO] 
[INFO] Results:
[INFO] 
[INFO] Tests run: 0, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0
[INFO] 
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

When removing the @BeforeAll annotation/method it fails as expected.

3.0.0-M3 version of Surefire works as expected:

[INFO] --- maven-surefire-plugin:3.0.0-M3:test (default-test) @ top-level-project ---
[INFO] 
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------
[INFO]  T E S T S
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Running Tests
[ERROR] Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.008 s <<< FAILURE! - in Tests
[ERROR] Tests  Time elapsed: 0.007 s  <<< FAILURE!
org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError: BeforeAll fail
	at Tests.beforeAll(Tests.java:7)

[INFO] 
[INFO] Results:
[INFO] 
[ERROR] Failures: 
[ERROR]   Tests.beforeAll:7 BeforeAll fail
[INFO] 
[ERROR] Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0
[INFO] 
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD FAILURE
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time:  2.373 s
[INFO] Finished at: 2019-08-20T16:20:16+02:00
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:3.0.0-M3:test (default-test) on project top-level-project: There are test failures.

For all the tests Maven 3.6.1 has been used.
item.summary: Junit Platform test with failing @BeforeAll does not fail the build

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Brand
This is probably old status of 3.0.0-SNAPSHOT.
Can you provide a pull-request with integration test (a new method testBeforeAllFailed)?
See the class JUnitPlatformIT.
I think the test will fail as expected.
With a newer snapshot after the one I tested while reporting the issue was not present anymore. Could you close it as explained? Thanks.

This is still broken, even with 3.0.0-M4. Here's the requested test case: https://github.com/apache/maven-surefire/pull/255

tibordigana Please reopen this issue.

marcphilipp First of all prove it in PR and provide a fix. Write integration test and fix it. We required integration tests in the early beginning when we adopted the project from the JUnit5. This did not happen.
Well, now you have one. You're welcome!

marcphilipp
I don't need it but you as it seems.
Brand
If you or Marc need to have a fix, i may help but feel free open a PR with the fix on GitHub. See the class RunListenerAdapter and debug the events.

I don't have time to work on a fix right now.

tibordigana Again, could you please reopen this issue?

marcphilipp
No, first provide the fix with the proofs. No reason to open something which does not want to be fixed by the contributor.

This is a real bug, I can't find a reason for closing the case.

When someone has time to fix the problem we will get a fix.

I find very useful the fact that marcphilipp created the test case.

eolivelli
I had to rework the IT test case because it influenced the old test results. So there is a new one.
And i introduced one more unit test.

Seems like Surefire 3.0.0-M4 loaded JUnit Platform artifacts version 1.3.2 into it's classpath. That seems to conflict with the version 1.6.0 the user requested by using JUnit Jupiter 5.6.0

See also: https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/2178
Failing test case was offered by Marc Philipp and another user reported the same issue at https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/2178

sor You are talking about another issue. I remember that the issue you described with the resolution of JUnit Platform artifacts versions was investigated few months ago. I digged into it that time and I have to do it again. I do not remember the details anymore.
Brand We fixed this usecase, see SUREFIRE-1741, in master. Pls install the snapshot version in your local repo and verify the fix with the command mvn -nsu test.
We tested it with our integration tests and the latest snapshot of master fixes it. Thanks for the fix!

Sounds great.

Thanks for clarifying, Tibor.
Thanks for verifying, Guy.

sor
I have reported the issue, as you described it using the log, in SUREFIRE-1750.
This project has moved from Jira to GitHub Issues. This issue was migrated to apache/maven-surefire#2078.
